means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 芬克绰号，来源于北方中世纪英语，含义是“雀科鸣禽”(finch)

sentence.Network_en: Don't be a rat fink, Jack.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要可恶地打小报告, 杰克.

sentence.Network_en: He is a fink . He has copped out.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是个工贼, 他妥协了.

sentence.Network_en: Mr. Fink had another role in crisis, without the government's help.
sentence.Network_cn: 芬克在危机中还有另外一个角色, 这个角色没有政府的帮助.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: of unknown origin; perhaps from German, literally 'finch', but also a pejorative term. Students started to refer to non-members of fraternities as finks, probably by association with the freedom of wild birds as opposed to caged ones. The term was later generalized to denote those not belonging to organizations such as trade unions
early 19th cent.: Anglicized form of South African Dutch vink 'finch'

means.word_mean: 1. someone acting as an informer or decoy for the police
